Cards.Question: What is a class in C#?
Cards.Answer: A class is a blueprint for creating objects (a particular data structure), providing initial values for state (member variables or attributes), and implementations of behavior (member functions or methods).

Cards.Question: What is an interface in C#?
Cards.Answer: An interface contains definitions for a group of related functionalities that a class or a struct can implement.

Cards.Question: What is a namespace in C#?
Cards.Answer: A namespace is used to organize your code and is collection of classes, interfaces, structs, enums, and delegates.

Cards.Question: What is a constructor in C#?
Cards.Answer: A constructor is a special type of method that is used to initialize objects.

Cards.Question: What is a destructor in C#?
Cards.Answer: A destructor is a special member function of a class that is executed whenever an object of its class goes out of scope or whenever the delete expression is applied to a pointer to the object of that class.

Cards.Question: What is a property in C#?
Cards.Answer: A property is a member that provides a flexible mechanism to read, write, or compute the value of a private field.

Cards.Question: What is a method in C#?
Cards.Answer: A method is a code block containing a series of statements. In C#, every executed instruction is done so in the context of a method.

Cards.Question: What is a field in C#?
Cards.Answer: A field is a variable of any type that is declared directly in a class or struct.

Cards.Question: What is a static class in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static class is a class that cannot be instantiated. In other words, you cannot use the new keyword to create a variable of the class type.

Cards.Question: What is a static method in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static method is a method that belongs to the type itself rather than to any object.

Cards.Question: How do you create a new object in C#?
Cards.Answer: You create a new object in C# by using the new keyword followed by the name of the class.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a class and a struct in C#?
Cards.Answer: A class is a reference type and a struct is a value type.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a method and a property in C#?
Cards.Answer: A method is a code block containing a series of statements and a property is a member that provides a flexible mechanism to read, write, or compute the value of a private field.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a field and a property in C#?
Cards.Answer: A field is a variable of any type that is declared directly in a class or struct and a property is a member that provides a flexible mechanism to read, write, or compute the value of a private field.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a class and an interface in C#?
Cards.Answer: A class is a blueprint for creating objects and an interface contains definitions for a group of related functionalities that a class or a struct

Cards.Question: Why are properties used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Properties are used in C# to provide a flexible mechanism to read, write, or compute the value of a private field.

Cards.Question: Why are methods used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Methods are used in C# to define the behavior of a class.

Cards.Question: Why are fields used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Fields are used in C# to store data.

Cards.Question: Why are constructors used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Constructors are used in C# to initialize objects.

Cards.Question: Why are destructors used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Destructors are used in C# to clean up resources.

Cards.Question: Why are namespaces used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Namespaces are used in C# to organize your code.

Cards.Question: Why are static classes used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Static classes are used in C# to create utility classes.

Cards.Question: Why are static methods used in C#?
Cards.Answer: Static methods are used in C# to create utility methods.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a static class and a non-static class in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static class cannot be instantiated and a non-static class can be instantiated.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a static method and a non-static method in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static method belongs to the type itself rather than to any object and a non-static method belongs to an object of the type.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a static field and a non-static field in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static field is shared among all instances of a class and a non-static field is unique to each instance of a class.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a static property and a non-static property in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static property is shared among all instances of a class and a non-static property is unique to each instance of a class.

Cards.Question: What is the difference between a static constructor and a non-static constructor in C#?
Cards.Answer: A static constructor is called once per type and a non-static constructor is called once per instance.
